ygData.subject: Re: Wizards
ygData.msgSnippet: I think the whole point is the game is oriented and balanced towards groups.  Trying to hold up the pluses and minuses of an individual class is pointless as
ygData.messageBody:
I think the whole point is the game is oriented and balanced towards
groups. Trying to hold up the pluses and minuses of an individual
class is pointless as they are each designed to be compensated by
another. Pennaggolan has it right and we need to view the complementary
benefits of each class in determining its abilities.

Plus after 20 Wizards don't need to ride that damn boat and that alone
makes them worthwhile.

Merauk
21 Enchanter
Cazic-Thule

-----Original Message-----
From: croesus
Sent: Friday, July 02, 1999 8:13 PM
To: .EQ.Magic
Cc: croesus
Subject: Re: [_EQ_Magic] Wizards

From: Silverlock <croesus@...>

At 01:21 PM 7/2/99 -0500, you wrote:

Until you get an overpull.

>From: Dan Alexander <dalex@...>
>
>At 01:29 PM 07/02/1999 -0400, you wrote:
>>>>>
>You really don't get it that Wizard's are group only. Certain classes
can
>solo but after level 25 no matter what class you play even necro it
becomes
>inefficent to solo. My friend is a level 40 Wizard and he can deal
damage
>just fine. A Wizzard and a Warrior are perfect for each other all you
need
>is a Cleric and your set. I just think you really missed the point of
the
>Wizard Class.
>
><<<<
>
>Last nights party consisted of a cleric, a druid, and four wizards.
The
>average Red lasted about 7 seconds, the Yellows lasted less than 5 - it
>looked like nighttime over Baghdad out there. A caster-heavy party
rocks! =)
>
>-Pennaggolan
>
